page.title: 16Public Transport.Wishford.
page.content: The A36 trunk road runs through the valley and so the villages are better served by buses than some rural areas. There are three Wilts.and Dorset services and one by Beeline Coaches. The Wilts.and Dorset services are the 248,270-273,and the X41 fast inter city bus.These services provide a bus nearly every two hours for most of the day,from Monday to Saturday.Beeline Coaches run service 25 which provides one bus on Tuesday and two on Saturday. Service X41,Salisbury to Bristol, follows the A36.Service 270,Salisbury to Bath branches off onto the B3083. The other services are local from Salisbury. The railway passes through Wishford but there is no train service to any of the villages.
